comment.body:
> @krisBonjour. Il semble que ce problème soit causé par cette règle : `||stripchat.com^$popup,third-party` veuillez ajouter cette règle comme solution temporaire jusqu'à ce que le problème mentionné ci-dessus soit résolu. Vous pouvez également suivre la réponse des développeurs. `||stripchat.com^$popup,third-party,badfilter`

Bonjour, merci pour les retours. **Je ne comprend pas et ne sais pas où il faut ajouter** " `||stripchat.com^$popup,third-party " ou " ||stripchat.com^$popup,third-party,badfilter " pour avoir de nouveau accès au site. Cela m'ennuie, mais depuis quelques jours j'utilise de nouveau l'extension que j'utilisais il y a plusieurs années (avant AdGuard), je parle de l'extension "uBlock Origin". Celle-ci bloque correctement et ne m'empêche pas d'aller sur certains sites Web bloqués dorénavant avec l'extension AdGuard. C'est vraiment dommage, car j'utilise AdGuard depuis plusieurs années et je suis déçu de ne plus pouvoir l'utiliser. Trop de problèmes ces derniers temps.

**Si quelqu'un peut m'expliquer où ajouter la règle ci-dessus, ça m'intéresse. Merci pour votre aide et vos retours.**

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock professional company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [microShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/blob/main/README.md).


## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues).
Please report to [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/166924) if other issue.

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/189265#issuecomment-2376657048 - Fixed ad placeholder (filters update should be available in 1-2 hours), but this `subscribe` link doesn't look annoying.
On the main page this `subscribe` link is displayed next to the date and in articles date element is not visible, but it's still there.
Hiding just a link will looks strange (there will be an empty space), but whole element cannot be just hidden because date on the main page will be not displayed.
You can add these rules:
```adblock
nytimes.com###masthead-bar-one span[data-campaign="ALL_ACCESS_PROMO_REPEATING_248"]
nytimes.com#?##masthead-bar-one:has(> div:has(> div[class^="css-"]:first-child:matches-css(display: none)):has(+ div[class^="css-"] > span[data-campaign="ALL_ACCESS_PROMO_REPEATING_248"]))
```
to user rules.

I can reproduce it only with DNS filtering enabled, but we cannot unblock it in DNS because it's used for ads.
You can try to add:
```adblock
@@||googleadservices.com^
```
to user rules in DNS filter.
